summary: The text discusses the concept of free will given to humans by God. It emphasizes that while God desired to gather His people, they refused. Despite their refusal, God gathered those He chose. It mentions the desolation of the Jewish temple and city of Jerusalem caused by Roman conquest as a divine abandonment due to their infidelity. Furthermore, it refers to a future prophecy where Jews will recognize Christ as blessed, prompted by the preaching of Elijah and Enoch at the time of judgment.
